According to a study by the University of Toronto's Citizen Lab, TikTok has been found to have security loopholes that could allow hackers to manipulate content and reveal personal information. Moreover, a 2020 survey by the Pew Research Center showed that 60% of US adults do not trust TikTok with their personal data. Given these valid concerns, it is crucial to limit the widespread use of TikTok and explore safer social media alternatives that provide robust data protection.
